sub_topic: Moduli spaces of algebraic curves and their properties
message_1: Consider the moduli space $\mathcal{M}_g$ of smooth algebraic curves of genus $g$. Let $n_g$ denote the dimension of this moduli space. Find the value of $n_g$ when $g = 4$.
message_2:
The dimension of the moduli space of smooth algebraic curves of genus g, denoted as $n_g$, can be found using the formula:

$$n_g = 3g - 3$$

When $g = 4$, we have:

$$n_g = 3(4) - 3 = 12 - 3 = 9$$

So, the dimension of the moduli space of smooth algebraic curves of genus 4 is 9.
